comments.body: maybe make a checking_imports.sh just to make style similar to existing

  - ci/lint.sh

  - source activate pandas && python ci/check_imports.py
  - echo "script done"

comments.body:
this looks good, but travis is complaining that the environment doesn't exist. This is likely to be because when doing the `conda env create` in `ci/install_travis.sh` the `-n pandas` is still used, and the environment is not created with the right name `pandas-dev`

also, in line 119 below, the source activate could be removed if it's still active from here (I don't think so), or change the name of the activated environment to `pandas-dev` too

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +106,110 @@script:
  - echo "script start"
  - source activate pandas-dev
  - ci/run_build_docs.sh
  - ci/script_single.sh
